isis.stitle: INTERNATIONAL® VT 365 DIESEL ENGINE - CYLINDER HEAD AND VALVE TRAIN - Component Removal - High-pressure Oil Rail System

figure.caption: Figure 111. Removal of hose from high-pressure oil rail

step1.para: Use a #10 Quick Release Tool to slide release ring back while pulling the oil hose outward from high-pressure oil rail.

figure.caption: Figure 112. Removing hose from crankcase-to-head tube assembly

note.para: When releasing the hose with the #6 Quick Release Tool, do not pry release ring off.

step1.para: Use a #6 Quick Release Tool to slide release ring back while lifting oil hose from crankcase-to-head tube assembly.
Remove eight M6 x 25 bolts that retain the oil rail assembly to rocker arm carrier.

figure.caption: Figure 113. Removing high-pressure oil rail assembly

step1.para: Lift oil rail straight up and away from injectors. Allow oil to drain back to the sump or some other suitable container.

figure.caption: Figure 114. Removing the crankcase-to-head tube assembly

step1.para: Remove the crankcase-to-head assembly in upper side of rocker arm carrier. Discard tube assembly and O-ring.

note.para: After removing the crankcase-to-head assembly, do not reattach it to the oil hose without the release ring.

para.title: High-pressure Oil Rail System Service (if required)

figure.caption: Figure 115. Oil rail check valve and plug

step1.para: Remove M14 internal hex plug and discard O-ring.
Remove oil rail check valve and discard O-ring.
Inspect the plug and check valve for cracks and worn threads. If either are found replace them.
Install new O-ring onto check valve and torque to special torque.
Install new O-ring onto the M14 internal hex plug and torque to special torque.

caution.para: To prevent engine damage, do not remove 1-1/4 x 20 UNF oil rail end plugs or the Acoustic Wave Attenuator (AWA) bottom port fitting. Service parts are not available.
